h2.span: In order to offer some normalcy during this unprecedented time, Tuolumne County educators are providing extended learning opportunities for students, including a county-wide collaborative effort that is developing short term and long term plans and resources for educators and families to continue their education and to continue individual contact with students. We anticipate that nearly four hundred general and special education teachers will be working together to provide multiple options for our students that will include online, paper/pencil, broadcast, and other innovative methods to ensure students still have access to quality instruction and their teachers.

span.h2: In response to the recent school closure, our website hasa new page!
Check it out foreasy access toonline and at-homeOptional Enrichment Activities.
span.p: We first ask our Mustang Families to StaySafe, Wash Your Hands, and Keep Learning! We will get through this together.

p.a: Tuolumne County Library - Access Resources and Check out Ebooks with your Library Card

span.p: More information will be posted as it is released.
If you have any further questions, please contact the School Office at (209)-532-1428
